medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported malaise, swollen glands, myalgias, and pressure and pain in the right upper quadrant of his abdomen two or three weeks ago. The patient describes his overall state then as feeling like he had the flu. Since that time, he experienced intermittent RUQ pain but was able to continue to work. Two days ago, after having a chicken sandwich and a beer, the RUQ pain peaked, described as sharp and crampy, radiating from the epigastric area to the back, with diminished appetite and only small meals consumable. The pain increased significantly, and he called for an urgent appointment.
medical_history.family_history: Thyroid problems, elevated blood pressure, diabetes mellitus
